data.title: Great Authentic Italian Cuisine!
data.text: If you're ever in Napa, looking for great Italian food then we'd recommend Ca'Momi. With so many Italian references, the menu does need some explanation which our server, Nicole, patiently did, bringing the dishes to 'life'. It's not an inexpensive restaurant but the ambience and food make it well worth it.  We respectively selected the Tagliatelle Funghi and Oxtail stew as our main meals, which simply wonderful.

data.title: Too Authentic Hipster Style Take on Italian Food!!
data.text: In the world of hipsters, this would be fabulous Italian food. Well I grew up with Italian American and genuine Sicilian food and I can't vaguely remember any of this so called 'authentic' food. I thought the menu was limited; I had the octopus 'humido' in polenta, which per the waitress was similar to lasagna. Well thank God it wasn't, however the polenta mixed with stewed octopus was interesting and messy, since the number of pieces of cut octopus were carefully counted. The rest of my family had the same mixed reviews.

data.title: DISAPPOINTING
data.text:
We were willing fans walking in as dedicated regulars at their first restaurant in Oxbow Market.  We found the menu to be limiting, the food disappointing, the ambience OK, and the staff knowledgeable but not helpful. 

They are trying for a fine dining experience but it is mid-range experience at best at fine dining prices.

data.title: Authentic Italian, to die for!!!
data.text:
My wife and I came here on the recommendation of the staff at the Blackbird Inn on 1st Street in Napa. The restaurant emphasises its authentic Italian menu and ingredients. The atmosphere was enlivened by the open cooking area which allowed diners to watch the chefs at work. Our server, Nataly, was very helpful and offered useful advice about menu choices.
We ordered the olives, which offered a generous selection flavoured with Mediterranean herbs, and the mixed salad. The salad was quite small with very thinly sliced carrots and squash served in a good vinaigrette dressing. The sauvignon blanc was a great wine to accompany these dishes.
We then shared a pizza, which was about 12" in diameter and sufficient for 2 of us. The pizza was cooked at a very high temperature (900*) for a short time so the dough remains soft and easy to cut. The toppings we chose blended very well giving an authentic Italian taste and resulted in a divine pizza!! We decided to have an Anchor beer with the pizza which was cold, crisp and slightly hoppy which made it ideal. 
We shared a Tiramisu for dessert; after all what else would be really authentic? It was rich, creamy and very moreish - highly recommended. The decaf espresso we had with dessert was very strong but very good.
As a nightcap I chose a Peruvian brandy which I'd never seen before. It was clear, rather than the amber colour of French or Spanish brandy. It had the taste of brandy but without the woody overtones of a conventional brandy. A very interesting drink!
This meal was like eating in a very good local restaurant in an Italian city, but in the heart of the Napa valley. Very highly recommended!!

data.title: Lively, interesting building and great food !
data.text:
We had pastas and pizzas ... both were interesting and delicious!
The waitress was very knowledgeable about the dishes and helped with pairing wines for the dinner.

data.title: When "obsessive" is a good thing!
data.text: We went there for my birthday dinner but we weren't hungry enough to order two dinners so we shared the porcini & tartufo pizza and the caprese salad with some Napa cab sav.  Everything was so good that we put aside our fullness and ordered two desserts - millefoglie and panna cotta alle pesche.  The restaurant was quite busy for a Wednesday night.  The wait-staff was attentive, friendly and helpful; the ambiance, romantic.

data.title: Good to excellent
data.text: Visited last night as wanted something decent to eat. We got this. They say the cook in a pure style and this is true. I had sweet breads to start and then tagliatelle which was great. Then had a desert which again was great. We had White wine by the same name. Really nice meal near end of holiday.

data.title: Most "Authentic" Restaurant Experience in Downtown Napa
data.text:
One of the best in Napa for a full authentic experience! I have lived in Napa for 5 years and frequented the Enoteca at Oxbow Market and now the restaurant on First Street 4-5 times.  The food is excellent and I always try something new and I am always so impressed. The service is impeccable, friendly, helpful, (especially since I cant pronounce anything on the menu!) and I love the ambiance of the restaurant.  My favorite dish is the roasted vegetables as a starter. They serve with plenty of bread and every time I have this dish it is roasted perfectly. The bread is their pizza dough and its surprising light but just chewy enough.  One time we had a small group and they brought us a complimentary dessert of fried pizza dough remnants drizzled with nutella and sprinkled with powdered sugar. It was SO good! 

Lately the bar has been packed and they make excellent cocktails and have great bartenders.  I love and appreciate most when a restaurant has consistency and every time I go there I am consistently impressed and happy with my food and service.  They have a late night music scene now that is very popular so if your looking for something to do late night this is the place.. They have some awesome talent coming thru there! Not your average "bar type singer songwriter with the John Mayer sound" that everyone else seems to have all the time. 

One more thing to add. I had a chance to sample most of their wines recently at another event and I was VERY surprised how good they all were.  Not one in the line up was a disappointment and for the price its the best value in Napa quite possibly. The prosecco was crisp and just a slight sugar on tongue but not like most. The pinot is bright fruit and perfectly balanced for a pinot and I can be picky on pinots. The cab and chardonnay are both clear winners and normally I would be hesitant to order the house wine but not here! 

If your looking for a perfect dining experience in Napa this is the place.. And best part is it feels like a small run restaurant where the owners are directly involved and really are committed to providing an authentic Italian experience. Not like some of the other "restaurant groups" that keep popping up in Napa.. This is the real deal!

data.title: Nice Italian restaurant
data.text: The place has a nice vibe and has some live entertainment on Friday & Saturday. The food is fit for foodies and non foodies as well. You can bring older children from 8 and up   and there is choices on the menu that will satisfy there palette. The service and staff were great. The food and cocktails were great.

data.title: Authentic taste of real Italy!
data.text:
I have visited Ca' Momi several times over the past few months and I have experienced excellent unique meals and consistently great service. The chefs recreate the family recipes with strict adherence to the original intent. 

The atmosphere is casual and can be a bit noisy when full to capacity. Overall it is well worth the trip to downtown Napa!

If you want to have your taste of Italy then make sure you go to Ca' Momi on your next  trip to Napa.

data.title: Great options for light lunch
data.text: Pizza was authentic! Reminded us of our visit to Italy and the pizza we had there. We went into Ca'Momi for a late light lunch and the options were great. We choose pizza and salads. Light refreshing cocktail was just that(with sprig of fresh lavender) REFRESHING!  Our server was lovely and efficient. She was new to the area, we had questions about directions and she sent over a very informative polite person to enlighten us. Thank you and keep up the good work with being authentic.

data.title: Fabulous service and food!
data.text: I made a reservation for a business lunch.  This was my first visit to the Osteria after years of enjoying the Enoteca at the Oxbow Public Market.  What made our meal, besides the incredible flavors of the panzanella, was our server, Daoud, who made our lunch quite enjoyable.

data.title: Wow, you could walk past this Gem!!
data.text:
We had a fantastic meal in great surroundings and fabulous staff. Authentic building with a really stunning wood burning oven. They also brew their own beer on site, not for outside sale but internal only, go try its great! We tried several dishes and shared, they were great! 
Living in London we are spoilt for Italian style places but this was just that bit better! Defiantly would return and in fact we are going to book for our last night!

data.title: Romantic Ambiance!
data.text: I was visiting Napa and met a friend for dinner.  We selected Ca' Momi Osteria at the last minute and the staff was very accommodating.  Food was delicious and the service was terrific. We loved the Caprese salad! Highly recommend if you are in downtown Napa.

data.title: Delicious!!
data.text: This was an unexpected find for us, and we will definitely be back. Fantastic cocktails, and really good food at reasonable prices. The pizzas were out of this world. Only drawback was a waiter who apparently stayed in the weeds most of the night. He was weak, but everything else was outstanding. I recommend.

data.title: A Bit Pretentious
data.text: This restaurant prides itself on using organic and locally sourced ingredients which is fine as far as it goes.  But I thought the food was only adequate.  The service was reasonably good.  The prices were pretty high for what we got.  The best part of the meal was the ice cream.  The flavors were off the beaten path but very good.  All in all It was not that impressive but I would give them another try.

data.title: Great drinks, meh food
data.text:
Had happy hour and dinner here and was very underwhelmed by the food. The happy hour deals for drinks and "bites" were good, but the real food (i.e. plates for dinner) was subpar. 

The bartenders were awesome, super friendly, and helpful with our drink orders, so let me give them all of the credit they deserve for their fantastic work. The cocktails are delicious. Definitely get one of the wine cocktails like the La Morosa.

The pizza was nothing special. For a restaurant that has brick, wood-fired ovens, the pizza is undercooked and you miss out on the crispy, smokiness that wood fires usually provide. We expected better, given the nice atmosphere and the aroma. Would not return unless just for drinks and happy hour.

data.title: Very good, service was top notch, flavors fresh
data.text:
I never thought of going to this place which is an off shoot of the Oxbow location. The place seemed contrived as were a winery first and then touristy eatery in the popular Oxbow market. I was very surprised at the attention to detail in the decor, the very pleasant staff even under busy conditions. Excellent recommendations on food choices. Quality and flavor of appetizers, (errata and roasted veggies were amazing), pizza and even the table olive oil.
There were really no negatives other than the iPad wine list. A long paper wine list is daunting enough but add to that descriptions and photos, well your not going anywhere fast.
All in all a very good experience.

data.title: Service,Service,Service
data.text:
Food is Italian cuisine based on "Mama's" recipes.  Don't know what region of Italy, but food was old world simple flavors with nice presentation.  Wine selection via iPad which made ordering much easier than trying to peruse a printed menu. Bar looked to be well stocked with a wide variety of spirits some from local distilleries.

If you have read any of my previous reviews, you will note that service and attention to detail are important. With today's roaming chef's capitalizing on bringing novel culinary takes to the masses with food trucks, I have found that the dining experience has to be judged on not only taste and presentation, but service as well.  Our experience at Ca Momi was made unique by the efforts of our server Daoud.  We defaulted to his suggestions and were overjoyed with the selections.  His attention to detail was incredible.  His personality was engaging, thoughtful, and non- assuming.  Could not have been happier with his service.

Our overall rating for the restaurant was a four but his service a 5!

data.title: Great food
data.text: Great salads, pizza, bur atta and veggies.  The wait staff was very good and attentive.  Very authentic too
